TEXT.English: The year is 2071. As constant unrest seethes beneath an unchanging balance of power among the elites, the superpowers of China, NAFTA, Russia, and the EU have reached an uneasy stalemate on a deteriorating Earth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The world seems suspended between chaos and stagnation - until unexpectedly, a half-forgotten collaborative project led by an international team of scientists detects evidence of a dormant wormhole-like anomaly lying hidden between Venus and Mercury. An exploratory craft is soon able to enter the anomaly; the spirit of cooperation quickly gives way to nationalist infighting among the project's sponsors as it becomes clear what has been revealed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The wormhole enables access to a handful of distant worlds; each Earthlike enough for human habitation, but home to exotic plant and mineral resources that could prove a boon to Earth's dying industry. Humanity is no longer alone - the worlds are sparsely inhabited by a handful of sentient alien species with bizarre language and customs but vaguely humanoid features. Further exploration uncovers faint traces of an incredibly advanced ancient race dubbed the Progenitors, whose lost technology constructed the wormhole as a means of transport, and who some believe created each of the races on the worlds it links - perhaps even Humanity itself.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Create a thriving colony among the planets of the New Worlds. Life on the stellar frontier is difficult; you begin with access to a limited selection of Colonists and resources and must research technologies to advance.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Revolution Victory:[\BOLD]Declare your independence from Earth after attaining 50%% Rebel Sentiment in all your colonies. Before time runs out, defend your fledgling nation from the wrath of your home planet by wiping out all their ground forces. You must complete your revolution before any other Earth Colony or Alien Empire. The corrupt superpowers of Earth are slowly crumbling; the Expeditionary Force starts powerful but grows slowly with time, making Independence an achievable goal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hegemony Victory:[\BOLD] Ensure the absolute hegemony of your nation over these New Worlds. Suppress the alien natives and subjugate or destroy the other colonies of Earth. Your colonies must grow to dominate the lands and inhabitants of the New Worlds before any other human or alien power reaches independence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Transcendence Victory:[\BOLD] Research the Transcendence tech, then be the first Human or Alien power to sell 1000 units of Progenitor Tech to Earth, using the lost secrets of the Progenitors to reshape the destiny of mankind.

As constant unrest seethes beneath an unchanging balance of power among the elites, the superpowers of China, NAFTA, Russia, and the EU have reached an uneasy stalemate on a deteriorating Earth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The world seems suspended between chaos and stagnation - until unexpectedly, a half-forgotten collaborative project led by a team of international scientists detects evidence of a dormant wormhole-like anomaly lying hidden between Venus and Mercury. An exploratory craft is soon able to enter the anomaly; the spirit of cooperation quickly gives way to nationalist infighting among the project's sponsors as it becomes clear what has been revealed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The wormhole enables access to a handful of distant worlds; each Earthlike enough for human habitation, but home to exotic plant and mineral resources that could prove a boon to Earth's dying industry. Your colonies must dominate the New Worlds before any other human or alien power reaches independence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Transcendence Victory:[\BOLD] Research the Transcendence tech, then be the first Human or Alien power to sell 1000 units of Progenitor Tech to Earth, using the lost secrets of the Progenitors to reshape the destiny of mankind.

TEXT.English: From across the Great Sea they came, in their ships of fiery metal. It is told that others of our race once journeyed to their star, watched them in secret from our sleek saucers. But now it is we who are watched. Lost on these forgotten planets, we have grown weak and backward, the secrets of the ancients lost to us. Sleeping among the sweet fungus, our people heed not the words of their elders as the Earthlings settle on our home, perhaps to drain it as they drained their own. What will it portend, the arrival of these thin-skinned creatures?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]For rules and strategy about playing an alien species, consult [LINK=CONCEPT_ALIENS]Alien Civilizations[\LINK] under the Game Concepts section in the Civilopedia.[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Place the settlements of your race. Living in a state of pastoral anarchy, your people must build a Ziggurat in each of your settlements to enable further development and trade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hegemony Victory:[\BOLD] Ensure the survival and dominance of your species. Expel the Earthling invaders and subjugate or destroy other alien races. Your Empire must dominate the New Worlds before any other human or alien power reaches independence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Revolution Victory:[\BOLD] Declare your independence from the Progenitor overlords after attaining a 50%% Rebel Sentiment in all your settlements. Before time runs out, defend your fledgling species from the Progenitors' wrath by wiping out all their ground forces. You must complete your revolution before any other Earth Colony or Alien Empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Transcendence Victory:[\BOLD] Research the Transcendence tech, then be the first to sell 1000 units of Progenitor Tech to Earth, using the lost secrets of the Progenitors to reshape the destiny of mankind.
TEXT.French: En l'an %s1_year, sa Majesté le roi des %s2_civ vous accorde une charte coloniale.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pour la plus grande gloire de la nation, %s3_leader, le roi vous nomme vice-roi du Nouveau Monde. Explorez cette terre, colonisez-la et apportez richesse et gloire à notre grande nation et à vous-même ! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pour parvenir à la victoire :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Fondez votre colonie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Atteignez un sentiment de révolte de 50%% dans toutes vos colonies pour pouvoir déclarer votre indépendance.[PARAGRAPH:1]Défendez votre nation naissante contre la colère de votre mère patrie en écrasant toutes leurs forces terrestres avant la fin du temps imparti.[PARAGRAPH:1]Vous devez être la première colonie européenne à terminer sa révolution !
TEXT.German: Im Jahre %s1_year übergibt Euch seine Königliche Hoheit, der König der Nation %s2_civ, eine Kolonialcharta. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Zum Ruhme der Nation ernennt der König Euch, %s3_leader, zum stellvertretenden Oberhaupt der Neuen Welt. Erforscht das neue Land, besiedelt es und bringt Euch und unserer großartigen Nation Ruhm und Reichtum. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Um den Sieg zu erringen:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Gründet Eure Kolonie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Erklärt Eure Unabhängigkeit von Eurem Mutterland, sobald mindestens 50%% Rebellische Stimmung in all Euren Siedlungen herrscht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Verteidigt Euer junges Land gegen den Zorn Eures Mutterlandes vor Ablauf der Zeit, indem Ihr all seine Bodeneinheiten auslöscht. [PARAGRAPH:1]Schließt Eure Revolution vor allen anderen europäischen Kolonien ab.
TEXT.Italian: Nell'anno %s1_year, sua maestà reale il re di %s2_civ ti conferisce uno statuto coloniale. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Per la maggiore gloria della nazione il re nomina te, %s3_leader, viceré del Nuovo Mondo. Esplora queste nuove terre, colonizzale e procura ricchezze e gloria a te stesso e alla nostra grande nazione. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Per ottenere una vittoria:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Fonda la tua colonia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dichiara l'indipendenza dalla madrepatria dopo aver ottenuto il 50%% di sentimento di ribellione in ogni insediamento.[PARAGRAPH:1]Difendi il giovane stato dall'ira della madrepatria annientandone le forze terrestri prima che scada il tempo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Devi completare la rivoluzione prima di qualsiasi altra colonia europea.
TEXT.Spanish: En el año de %s1_year Su Majestad, el rey de %s2_civ, os concede una carta colonial. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Para mayor gloria de la nación, el rey os nombra a vos, %s3_leader, virrey del Nuevo Mundo. Explorad esta nueva tierra, civilizadla y ganad la gloria para vos y para nuestra gran nación. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Para conseguir una victoria:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Fundad vuestra colonia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Declaraos independientes de la madre patria tras conseguir un 50%% de sentimiento de rebelión en todos vuestros asentamientos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Defended vuestro incipiente país de la cólera de la madre patria acabando con todas las fuerzas terrestres de ésta antes de que se acabe el tiempo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Debéis completar vuestra revolución antes que ninguna otra colonia europea.

TEXT.English: %s1_city can train the following units. Select how many units you want to be trained of each profession.

TEXT.English: Orders a new unit automatically whenever no unit is trained. Multiple repeating units is possible and an equal number will be trained of each.

TEXT.Spanish: Orders a new unit automatically whenever no unit is trained. Multiple repeating units is possible and an equal number will be trained of each.

TEXT.English: Select goods that will be sold by Custom House, and select mimimum amount of a specific yield to enable Custom House to sell such yield in city %s1_city
TEXT.French: Sélectionner les biens que le Poste de Douane va vendre, ainsi que le seuil de marchandises qui déclenche la vente de celle-ci pour la colonie suivante: %s1_city
TEXT.German: Wähle Güter, die auf dem heimischen Markt verkauft werden sollen, sowie eine Mindestschwelle ab der das Zollhaus in %s1_city verkaufen soll.
TEXT.Italian: Select goods that will be sold by Custom House, and select mimimum amount of a specific yield to enable Custom House to sell such yield in city %s1_city

TEXT.French: On the domestic market of %s1_city goods for %d2[ICON_GOLD] have been sold.
TEXT.German: Auf dem Markt von %s1_city wurden Güter für %d2[ICON_GOLD] verkauft.
TEXT.Italian: On the domestic market of %s1_city goods for %d2[ICON_GOLD] have been sold.
TEXT.Spanish: On the domestic market of %s1_city goods for %d2[ICON_GOLD] have been sold.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "barbarian" was created by the Greeks; it was originally used to denote any foreigner. Since then it has gained a more negative connotation, and it is commonly applied to civilizations deemed "inferior" to one's own. The Chinese, for instance, thought of all foreign cultures - everybody from the Manchus to the Turks to the Europeans - as barbarians. Rome applied it to the Huns and the Germanic tribes, as well as to the more advanced Gauls.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV, the term denotes people that are not part of any organized civilization appearing in the game, but are instead old-style hunter-gatherers who prey on the "weak" civilized world. Though some barbarians may have acquired fairly advanced weaponry - swords and axes, for example - and though they may occasionally capture or even build their own cities, they remain at heart brigandic nomads, destroying everything that comes in their path. Barbarians cannot be bargained with or appeased: they must be destroyed - before they destroy you!
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme "Barbare" est à l'origine un critère linguistique utilisé par les Grecs pour désigner toute personne étrangère à la civilisation grecque. Depuis, ce terme a pris une connotation péjorative et s'applique aux civilisations jugées "inférieures". Les Chinois, par exemple, considéraient toutes les cultures étrangères, des Mandchous aux Turcs en passant par les Européens, comme des barbares. Rome utilisait ce terme pour désigner les Huns, les Gaulois et les tribus germaniques.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dans Civilization IV, le terme "Barbares" désigne des gens qui ne font partie d'aucune civilisation organisée du jeu. Il s'agit de chasseurs-cueilleurs qui n'ont pas peur de s'attaquer au monde civilisé. Bien que certains barbares aient pu acquérir un armement assez avancé, avec notamment des épées et des haches, et bien qu'ils puissent à l'occasion capturer ou même fonder leurs propres villes, ils restent avant tout des "bandits-nomades", détruisant tout sur leur passage. Il est impossible de négocier avec des barbares ni même de les apaiser : il faut les éliminer avant qu'ils ne vous éliminent !
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Barbar" kommt aus dem Griechischen und bezeichnete in seiner ursprünglichen Bedeutung alle Nichtgriechen. Seither haftete dem Wort allerdings eine immer negativere Assoziation an und heute wird es im Allgemeinen als Bezeichnung für primitivere, "unterlegenere" Zivilisationen verwendet. Die Chinesen betrachteten beispielsweise alle fremden Kulturen - wirklich alle, von den Manchus über die Türken bis hin zu den Europäern - als Barbaren. Rom benutzte den Begriff für die Hunnen und die germanischen Stämme sowie für die immerhin etwas fortschrittlicheren Gallier.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV sind mit den "Barbaren" Völker gemeint, die keiner der organisierten Zivilisationen im Spiel angehören, sondern eher in die Kategorie "Jäger und Sammler" eingeordnet werden können und die "schwache" zivilisierte Welt mit Überfällen heimsuchen. Zwar gibt es vereinzelt Barbaren, die über relativ fortschrittliche Waffen verfügen - zum Beispiel Schwerter und Äxte - und sie können auch gelegentlich Städte erobern oder sogar eigene Städte gründen, dennoch bleiben sie im Herzen stets räuberische Nomaden, die alles zerstören, was sich ihnen in den Weg stellt. Barbaren lassen sich nicht beschwichtigen und auch nicht mit sich handeln - deshalb sollten sie möglichst schnell vernichtet werden, bevor sie eine ernsthafte Bedrohung darstellen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il termine "barbaro" venne coniato dai Greci e inizialmente veniva utilizzato per indicare qualsiasi straniero. Da allora, la parola ha assunto una connotazione negativa e viene associato a quelle civiltà definite "inferiori". I Cinesi, per esempio, identificavano tutte le culture straniere come "barbare" dai Manciù ai Turchi agli Europei. Roma bollò con questo termine gli Unni e le popolazioni germaniche, così come i Galli che erano culturalmente evoluti.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV, questo termine indica le popolazioni che non fanno parte di una civiltà organizzata, vecchi cacciatori che predano i "deboli" nel mondo. Malgrado alcuni barbari abbiano conquistato armamenti più evoluti come spade e asce, e talvolta possano conquistare o fondare delle città, i Barbari rimangono prevalentemente nomadi che distruggono e saccheggiano tutto ciò che capita a tiro. Non si può trattare con i Barbari: devono essere distrutti prima che loro distruggano te!
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El término "bárbaro" fue acuñado por los griegos, y originalmente se utilizaba para referirse a cualquier extranjero. Pero desde entonces ha adquirido unas connotaciones negativas, pues suele emplearse al hablar de las civilizaciones a las que se considera "inferiores" a la propia. Los chinos, por ejemplo, pensaban que todas las culturas extranjeras (desde los manchúes a los turcos, pasando por los europeos) eran bárbaras. En Roma se empleaba el término para referirse a los hunos y las tribus germanas, así como a los galos, que eran más avanzados.[PARAGRAPH:2]En Civilization IV, este término engloba a todos los pueblos que no forman parte de ninguna civilización organizada del juego, y en lugar de eso se componen de cazadores-recolectores que atacan al "débil" mundo civilizado. Aunque algunos bárbaros pueden llegar a adquirir armas bastante avanzadas (espadas y hachas, por ejemplo), y aunque de vez en cuando pueden capturar ciudades o construir las suyas propias, en el fondo siguen siendo unos nómadas bandidos que lo destruyen todo a su paso. No se puede negociar con ellos, ni es posible aplacarlos: ¡hay que destruirlos antes de que ellos te destruyan a ti!

TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]animaux[COLOR_REVERT] attaquent les colons sans protection. Prenez garde !
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]animali[COLOR_REVERT] attaccano i coloni senza scorta! Fai attenzione!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Animales[COLOR_REVERT] dan caza a los colonos desprotegidos! ¡Tened cuidado!

TEXT.English: [H1]Animals[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]At the start of a game of Civilization IV, predatory animals may be found roaming about the world. These animals will attack any units they encounter; unarmed settlers and workers are especially at risk. Animals can be fought and destroyed just like any other unit in the game. Animals will not appear in or move into areas within a [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]National Border[\LINK]; they will gradually disappear as more and more of the world is claimed.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: [H1]Animaux[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Au début d'une partie de Civilization IV, des prédateurs errent dans le monde. Ces animaux attaquent les unités qui passent à leur portée. La menace est particulièrement grande pour les unités désarmées comme les ouvriers ou les colons. Les animaux sauvages peuvent être combattus et détruits comme toute autre unité du jeu. Ils n'apparaissent pas ni ne circulent dans les zones délimitées par une [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Frontière nationale[\LINK]. Ils disparaîtront progressivement au fur et à mesure de l'extension des implantations humaines.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: [H1]Tiere[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Am Anfang eines Spiels leben in Civilization IV in aller Welt Raubtiere, die Ihre Einheiten attackieren. Gefährdet sind vor allem unbewaffnete Siedler und Bautrupps. Natürlich können auch Tiere bekämpft und vernichtet werden. Tiere wagen sich nicht in Gebiete mit [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK]. Mit zunehmender Besiedlung der Welt sterben die Tiere langsam aus.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Tierarten[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Animali[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV, all'inizio di una partita si possono trovare animali predatori in giro per il mondo. Questi animali attaccano ogni unità che incontrano: i coloni e i lavoratori disarmati corrono dei seri pericoli. Gli animali possono essere affrontati e sconfitti proprio come qualsiasi altra unità di gioco. Gli animali non appaiono o si muovono in zone all'interno dei [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini nazionali[\LINK]; gli animali spariranno lentamente mano a mano che il mondo verrà colonizzato.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Animales[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Al empezar el juego Civilization IV, se pueden encontrar depredadores pululando por el mundo. Estos animales atacarán a cualquier unidad que encuentren; corren especial peligro los colonos y trabajadores que van desarmados. Se puede combatir a los animales y destruirlos como si fueran cualquier otra unidad del juego. Los animales no aparecerán tras la [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontera de una nación[\LINK] ni la cruzarán e irán desapareciendo gradualmente a medida que se conquisten más partes del mundo.[PARAGRAPH:2]
